website_summaries.verdict: Though it may not offer much relief from clinical repetitive stress injuries, the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Desktop 7000 will satisfy users who want a slightly more comfortable keyboard and mouse than the one that came with their computer.
pros: split keyboard design with raised center makes for comfortable typing
programmable quick-launch keys cut down on mousing
unique mouse design keeps wrist at a neutral angle
cons: Keys and scroll wheel offer a bit too much resistance for ultimate comfort

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the wireless unit
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the most ergonomic one you can buy, however the wireless capability is so poor that it makes this product unusable. My keyboard had to be within 2 1/2 feet of the computer to work reliably, otherwise it would start missing keystrokes, and as the distance increased it would loose touch altogether. I strongly recommend the wired version of this unit. I returned my wireless version for one. It works very well, and when you get used to the unique shape and position it allows faster and more comfortable typing. The wrist position and the soft wrist rest works for stress-free typing as opposed to conventional keyboards which forces wrist pronation, stress and wrist fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: N. Marko

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard but grossly overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Good keyboard and I have learned to like the handshake mouse. I've used this since January 2013. No real problem except the viability of the letter on the keys was bad so I glued on a set of big bright yellow labels and it improves the usability. Why isn't it manufactured like this. The labels are OK but add a rough edge to the keys. Also, the current price on Amazon is $489.99. I paid $79.41 in 2013, a reasonable price. What is going on?
customer_reviews.author: Demerzel

customer_reviews.title: I have this exact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have this exact keyboard and I really like it but there is no way on GODs earth that I would pay $800 dollars. If I recall I must have paid like $79.00. Amazon should not even allow these vendors to post their merchandise at these ridiculous prices.
customer_reviews.author: Rene M. Garcia Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The mouse sucks
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a Mac, so your mileage may vary. The mouse is terrible. It's quite uncomfortable, and the wheel is almost impossible to roll. The keyboard is ok, but two problems plague it. The first is that the connection sometimes dies. This can be solved by pulling the USB dongle out, and then plugging it back in. The other is that it sometimes skips key presses. I've read that this is a problem that is systemic. The keys themselves are ok, but not great. It's not super loud when typing on it. Most of the multi-media keys don't work on the Mac, or at least not without the Microsoft software, which I don't have installed.
customer_reviews.author: Rick LobrechtTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Purchased several years ago and still works ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Purchased several years ago and still works great! Only trouble is the batteries... when they start to go, you need to have replacements readily available or you are keyboardless... hopefully, you'll have your old, wired one handy. Same goes with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: House Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice combo!
customer_reviews.text: I have already bought a MS Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 before I placed this order. The keyboard works similarly, and it's very comfortable typing with it. My desk is not big, but it is interesting that if I raise the keyboard's two footers, it can be placed over my laptop's keyboard, which saves a lot of space. The space key might be tough to hit in the beginning, but it will be easy to use after a week or so. The mouse looks pretty ergonomic, too. The problem is... I still can't get used to it and make full use of the ergonomic feature. That is why I give a four star.
customer_reviews.author: St3fan

customer_reviews.title: My 5th purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands and big fingers, and this keyboard fits me perfectly. I'm on my fifth set, not because they break, but because I love them so much and their not very portable, I've bought several so I can store them in all my various work spots and always have one wherever I am. The mouse isn't as huge as I want it to be, but it's better than any regular mouse. The only thing I've had to do is disable the two thumb buttons because I never use them and always used to wind up launching 'magnifier' accidentally. This is a really great keyboard that will help keep you typing for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic design allows me to work for hours without any soreness. The weight of the mouse took some getting used to. My forearm was a little sore for the first few days (with heavy use), but I haven't had any problems since. Just had to train a few muscles that I didn't use before (these aren't the carpal tunnel muscles, it was the back of my forearm). These do take up more space than a normal keyboard and mouse. I love that the design allows me to type faster than with another keyboard since my wrists are bent at an unnatural angle.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had seen the reviews about the wireless problem before I ordered. I have had mine for a year. I've used and loved other Microsoft ergonomic keyboards for over ten years. But this one is very frustrating. As others have written....it stops typing. When this happens, I slow down and use one finger; it takes about 20 seconds to catch up... or sometimes refuses to work. Then I have to use the reset button on the bottom of the keyboard. I have gotten used to the size of the mouse, however it doesn't glide as smoothly on surfaces as my smaller Microsoft mouse does.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS.  RUN THE OTHER WAY.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you do, DO NOT BUY THIS OVERPRICED PIECE OF JUNK. The zoom stops working within a few days. It stops registering the keys you are pressing. It is the most overpriced, unreliable keyboard EVER MADE. I owned two now. After my similar experience with the first one, when I purchased a new keyboard, the brand was cheap and flimsy but did consistently work. NOT THIS hunk of junk. I hoped it would not fail but it has. I love the contour of it but that's it. DON'T buy it. If you do, hold onto to the expensive, elaborate packaging for return.
customer_reviews.author: Renee D

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Ergonomic Desktop 7000--great product except for occasional dead spots
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well-designed product as far as the physical shape and functionality is concerned. Occasionally I've had a little problem with the wireless part. Sometimes the curser doesn't move when I move the mouse, it doesn't click when I click the mouse and sometimes the letters don't show up when I type on the keyboard. It could be a computer problem (and not the fault of this product) but my other wireless mouse would work when this one didn't, so I'm thinking it is this product. It doesn't happen often, but is frustrating when it does. I don't regret buying this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: quicksand

customer_reviews.title: For Me, A Necessity...
customer_reviews.text: With nerve damage in both hands, I almost have to have a 7000 or 4000 series (these have the convex hump, not the concave one, as the 5000--those are tolerable, but... ). Hopefully Microsoft will not discontinue this line. I will say I've had one that failed within a few months; odd, because I had a wired one provided by former employer for several years prior to retirement, never had a problem with it. Some folks don't like the "curved" ergonomic keyboards--to me, even those that are conventional (no vertical curving, just the horizontal layout) allow your hands to be in a more natural position.
customer_reviews.author: Mick D

customer_reviews.title: Author needs...
customer_reviews.text: Typing a lot makes one's arm and hand bones ache after long periods of typing, holding wrists straight, and hands prepared to strike a normal, good keyboard. However, the straight hand effect becomes painful. This MS keyboard is really good, because it was designed for wrist aches... There are new ways to type with this, which is distracting at first, but it has helped reduce and sometimes eliminate the wrist pain. I have not had it long enough to say it completely eliminaged the wrist pains, but at least the pains have decreased since I got it. Thank you Microsoft! And thank you AMAZON for introducing it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Braungart

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED - Absolute garbage not any more
customer_reviews.text: [UPDATE] I need to update my review. It seems all of my issues were caused by out of date USB drivers on my computer at work. I had to update them for a usb video card and everything seems to be working fine. If you are having trouble update your USB/chipset drivers. The wireless keyboard is unusable. Drops keys, repeats keys for no reason, stops responding for 30 seconds at a time while the mouse is still working. This product should be recalled and full refunds given to all purchasers. Do not buy this. You will regret it. I took a chance, don't get burned like I have.
customer_reviews.author: EthR

customer_reviews.title: great for my wrists
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for a keyboard and mouse that were ok with my wrists but still wireless. This does occasionally have connection issues, and it can get frustrating, but I moved the computer so the usb stick was facing where the keyboard was and it seemed to help significantly. I use these at home and at work and I'm typing all day long. Except for the occasional glitches these fulfill all my needs. The space bar is a little loud, especially when I"m typing quickly but the key-presses are soft and comfortable. I now blame all typos in real time communication on the wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnita

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar issues NOT resolved
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product and I loved the mouse. But the center spacebar felt like it was an afterthought. It wobbled and my thumbs were so sore from having to work so hard just to get it to work. I ended up getting a Logitech wave keyboard and though I really like the use of my spacebar on this one, I wish I could have had the true ergonomic split of the Microsoft keyboard. If they would just fix that spacebar I would have kept it until it waxed old and died just like its predecessor, which was also a Microsoft product. Quality control, Microsoft, quality control.
customer_reviews.author: CB Deaux

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm stuck with it, but not too happy. The keys get stuck so the letter keeeeeeeps going.... Just like that but could go on for a whole page and really fast. Not just a particular letter either, anyone of them have gotten stuck multiple times in a day. Secondly, there is no indicator when you have the caps button depressed. My prior keyboards have never had these two problems. Also, there are a lot of functions such as zoom, favorites etc, but none work. That problem may involve user error, but I don't know how to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: SUNSHINE

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but broke after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: IT is convenient when you want keyboard close to you and no wires. The keyboard battery doesn't seem to last very long however. The mouse battery time is better. I use my originally cable keyboard around as backup. 2 years later - space key no longer working. Don't know if 2 years is typical life of this keyboard. I tried repairing it to no avail. I would buy again it if was around the $50-60 range but now it is listed on Amazon at over $400 which is a joke. I'm lowering my rating from 4 stars to 2 primarily because little value for the new price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Fenton

customer_reviews.title: I like the part that says it works reliably up to 30ft away.
customer_reviews.text: I like they layout of this keyboard and have had the wired version long enough that the keys are bald and black. I purchased two of these one for work and one for home. Neither of them could reliably type for more than an hour on fresh batteries within 6 inches from the receiver. Within hours you may find your self raised to the level of pounding the keyboard as you get up from your chair to hit the green button and then the grey button to sync for the 200th time today. Save your money and get the wired version of the keyboard if you are invested into the layout you will save your self on hours of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: This is the best keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite keyboard I have ever used. I had this keyboard for over 8 years and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: charleagh2525

customer_reviews.title: Space bar flaw
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the design but hated the space bar action. It felt like you needed a hammer to get the space bar to assert the space character. As a programmer, I have fetish for a good keyboard and fell... I was excited when I seen this design but left disappointed when the action was so bad on the space bar. The other keys were fine but since we use the space bar 40% of the time, it should be light to the touch and shouldnt take 50 grams of force to assert it. I give the overall design 4.5 stars and the space bar 0.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: K&G

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but......
customer_reviews.text: I had the model 4000 of this keyboard, which is corded. I had to purchase a new keyboard and thought I would try this model. I love everything about it, except, It really hangs up when typing and you have to pause and wait on it to catch up. Same thing happens with the mouse from time to time. I'm not that fast, but when you are on a roll and have to go back and wait for everything to catch up and then retype, it's a pain. I have done some upgrades to my computer and will see if that helps some. If so and it solves this problem, I would change my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crabb

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from previous versions, padded wrist rest makes a difference. Mouse seems big, and will take some getting used to, but it feels good -- no strain at all in my wrist or hand. Very happy with this keyboard/mouse combo. Note that the Item Description on Amazon says the keyboard IS NOT compatible with Mac, that it's only for Windows. The Microsoft website, however, says that this keyboard is Mac compatible. So I contacted Microsoft about his, and they reassured me that the keyboard does work with Mac. And in fact, when the item arrived it came with a Mac installation CD in the box.
customer_reviews.author: A. O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard & Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line and worth every penny. I love it. A few weeks into using it I'm still getting adjusted to the large "N" key and smaller "DEL" key. I had to lower the keyboard tray on my workstation as the mouse is a full 1 1/4 inches taller than the mouse from the Microsoft Wireless Natural Multimedia Keyboard/Mouse combo I used previously. The Mouse is very comfortable and natural to use and I no longer experience wrist fatigue/pain with this newer design. Despite these two minor caveats, I felt worth mentioning, it's a super keyboard mouse combo.
customer_reviews.author: TheDogMonster

customer_reviews.title: My hands Hurt
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this would be ideal since my physical therapist thought I needed an ergonomic keyboard. This is very large and awkward so it makes my hands hurt because it is shaped in an odd way. Even the mouse is awkward and both seemingly have trouble staying on task as it relates to the cursor and typing. Batteries last pretty good as I have replaced them twice in one year with daily usage. It is okay but I wish I never got rid of the regular one that came with my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Sinteeyaki

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic wireless keyboard and wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've used these type of ergonomic keyboards and mouse in the past so when I purchase my new laptop it only made sense to get another one. Being a big guy, I like the fact that the keyboard turns out so I don't feel cramped or like I'm squeezing my hands and wrists together. With the natural curved keyboard it takes all the pressure off my wrist and hand tendons. I'm impressed with the design of the mouse as it turns my hands slightly to the side as opposed to being on the top of the device. Lastly, I like the wireless feature as I'm not getting caught up in tangle of wires.
customer_reviews.author: David Kisler

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft makes great peripherals, usually.
customer_reviews.text: And this is no exception. I have two sets of this product, one I bought for work and it is on a PC and the other for home and it is on a Mac. If anything, the Mac version of the software is better than the PC version, but both work quite well. The wireless is solid (unless your cell phone is laying on the keyboard) and the key feel and the comfort of the semi-vertical mouse are very good. I recommend a mousepad because the mouse is heavy and at least on my desk surface it's easier to glide about with a mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burch

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and thus far quite pleased. The mouse is a little odd shaped, which I can adjust too over time. However getting it to track perfectly horizontal might be a challenge due to how my hand rests on it. We'll see. I have the MS Keyboard 4000, which I love, and this seems to keep pace. I would like to have the numlock and capslock lights but perhaps that's to conserve battery. As for range, the keyboard is about five feet from my computer and seems to have no apparent issues. If you like the 4000 I think you'll like the 7000.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Willener

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics!
customer_reviews.text: I received my new keyboard and mouse today! I am excited and working to get accustomed to the newness of it all; I have never used an ergonomic keyboard and mouse before, but I do a great deal of typing and mouse activity and I was beginning to notice wrist discomfort. Anyway, so far so good. I just need to become accustomed to the keyboard layout. I love the mouse already because there is relief, plus I like the features available on the mouse and keyboard, like zoom features and lock and drag. I am happy I was able to get this set for the price too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Like the wired, had problems with the wireless.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of these keyboards. Our entire office of developers has switched to using these. Only negative is that if you use it a lot like I do for work for programming, it does wear down faster than I would have liked. This unit did not work, there seemed to be some issues communicating (both the mouse and keyboard) with the computer. Constant lag and jumping, very frustrating. The wired version of the keyboard gets 5 stars. The mouse I won't buy again, will stick with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard and mouse for about year now. I bought it because I loved wireless concept. Well... I have been noticing SEVERE delay with the keystroke and mouse... to a point where is is almost unusable b/c it is keep mistyping and missing the location where my mouse is supposed to be. I have the USB receiver right next to the keyboard... so it cannot be the distance issue. I also tested against different computers and got the same result. I had enough. I have no problem if i use wired mouse and keyboard. This is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: HTM

customer_reviews.title: hiccups occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Lots of featureson the keyboard and the mouse has neat features also. Only glitch I've noted is the keyboard on occasion quits talking to the computer. Might be interferrence from wireless phone, router or something else I haven't figure out. When it looses the link, I just move it a couple inches and I'm back in business. Didn't notice the problem with the HP keyboard system that came with the computer. Switched to the ergonomic MS one since I had a wired one before and really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Continual Issues With Multiple Keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I write this on my backup wired keyboard because my second copy of this particular keyboard has gone down for the same reason as the first one: An inability to communicate wirelessly over the open air 8 inches between the keyboard and receiver. Both keyboards worked for a few months and then just randomly stopped working correctly, missing letters altogether or inserting multiples, etc. This is the only full ergonomic wireless I have been able to find on the market, which is why I tried a second one. Wired from here out until a new one comes out.
customer_reviews.author: NATHANIEL

customer_reviews.title: Great Ergonomics but Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: I loved my original version of this keyboard and ordered another, because it essentially saved my career by reducing the pain in my hands and forearms from typing all day as a tax preparer. But this second keyboard has been glitchy. It seems to have trouble consistently communicating with the wireless receptor, which I have moved several times closer and closer to the mouse and keyboard. But the mouse occasionally skips, and the keyboard occasionally misses letters, or types multiple letters with a single keystroke. It's super frustrating, and I have been all over the online forums without finding a solution. It wouldn't be a huge deal except this isn't a $100 keyboard, it's a $400 keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Great set up
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the Desktop 6000 for me. I had literally worn out the mouse and a couple of the keys were getting unresponsive after years of use. The new keyboard layout is a bit different and it is taking some time to get used to that. Love the zoom in the middle of the keyboard and fast access to favorites. Have always like the ergo mouse, but have read that some people with smaller hands do not like it. It works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: clift419

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Microsoft's split keyboards. I also like this mouse. I have large hands and most mice get uncomfortable after a while and cause carpal tunnel. To my surprise the oddly shaped mouse in this set is quite comfortable. I gave this four stars, not five. This is because the usb transceiver is big and sticks out from my laptop. I'd like to see this smaller, but what would be really amazing is if this could work with bluetooth. With that I'd give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Flaxman

customer_reviews.title: Old model, availabitlity is the big deal here
customer_reviews.text: Our boss insisted on this keyboard. Amazon.com was the only place to buy it. This model has a huge dongle, and just seems to have a lot of problems of batching up keystrokes. The boss finally gave up and went with a wired mouse. I took the keyboard and used it myself and saw the same problems. New batteries did not change it. The new one had the same problem. It's an old design. Aside from the extreme shaped mouse, there is no reason to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Great except keys started wearing off after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I type more quickly and with more comfort. I have been using this keyboard and mouse for a couple of months without having to change the batteries. I work on my computer 10+ hours a day, 5 days a week. Within weeks of receiving this item, the letters on the keys began to wear off. My "E" key is completely gone and about 5 other keys have early signs of wearing off. While I don't usually look at the keys as I type, it is annoying that the keyboard already looks old and worn.
customer_reviews.author: Avid typist

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had done more research as found similar keyboard at office Depot for less, but not the mouse, love the way the mouse fits my hand and that is what I wanted as I have trouble with my wrist. The only problem is it doesn't glide as smooth as I am used to for my graphic design and am afraid I may have to change, going to try a few things before I change, got a mousepad, to see if surface was problem and that did help, we have lots of dust, so need to clean it more often. Keyboard has helped with pain problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but only holds up for a year...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased one of these and they seem great to start but they quickly have problems. Maybe it's just me but I expect something that costs $80 to last longer than a year. The letters start wearing off after a month or so which didn't bother me since I don't really look down to type but might be an issue for some. But the space bar is the biggest problem with the design because it starts to stick and then quickly breaks. Even though it's really comfortable to use I won't be wasting my money on it again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I think this keyboard is fantastic, however the list price hasn't changed over the last few years and improvements to the keys could be made that make the keys smoother over time. I've owned 4 of these and used them at work and home just about every day. On occasion the keyboard seems to have a delay on keystroke to computer response on all of the ones I've owned. That occasional issue seems related to something environmentally changing because it is at times months between the issue and it eventually goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Blazer Figher S-PGH, PA

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard excellent.  Mouse is just silly.
customer_reviews.text: My Logitech ergonomic keyboard gave up and they no longer make that model. I ordered this one with some trepidation because the Logitech fit and worked so well. The keyboard is even better than the Logitech and I had no trouble getting used to it. I have had no trouble at all with the space bar, with either right or left hand. The mouse, however, is ridiculous. It fits my hand like a tennis ball and moving it is pretty much like trying to push a tennis ball around. I am still using the mouse that came with my Logitech set. I wish the wireless keyboard came without the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Draco

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Desktop keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the keyboard and mouse a little more than four (4) weeks now. The mouse took a little getting used to as it seemed huge but it is more natural for the hand and my arm, wrist and hand don't hurt after extensive use. I haven't really noticed that the keys are loud when pressed. I guess it all depends on the amount of pressure used. I really like the keyboard design. It is a more natural way of holding your wrists. I would definitely recommend this product for those with carpel tunnel or repetitive syndrome. For the price you just can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: dink

customer_reviews.title: Sticky keys after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when I got it. 6 months later, the enter key is sticking so bad it's actually making making my carpal tunnel worse. The fact that the enter is hit with the pinky obviously doesn't help. I wouldn't mind so much if this were an old product. But it's only 6 months old. And I've had the same problem with the 4000 keyboard. The mouse scrollbar is useless with middle click, but I worked around that, learnt to adapt to it. the sticky keys are really just s*** though. It's horrible. Stay away from this.
customer_reviews.author: dartarrow

customer_reviews.title: Best ergo keyboard you can get
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Microsoft ergonomic keyboards since about 1994. I write this review in 2019 and am still using them. Without these keyboards my wrists quicly become tired and hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hall

customer_reviews.title: What a WASTE of money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this desktop set less than a week ago. Loved the Wired Ergo Keyboard (4000) so I wanted to go wireless. The mouse works like a charm but the Keyboard does not... . I Thought were the batteries included, so changed them and still the same...Resetted connection on receiver/keyboard thousands of times and nothing, randomly works and suddenly keyboard goes away when I'm typing. Since I'm not from US it's a total waste of money requesting a replacement...so is this desktop set. Next time I'll listen to my friends and get a Logitech one. Real bad product, not recommended since I've seen some really bad reviews about it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: 15 Years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Microsoft natural keyboards for 15 years and can't type with anything else. This wireless keyboard is smooth but the space bar is a little too loose and I think in another review I read the same thing. The mouse is like driving a Mercedes it will take a little to get use to but I have no doubt that when I do get use to it I will love it. I do think that they need to tighten up the space bar and when they do I'll buy another one. So I'm going to rate this at 4.75 stars, I really do love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This can't be from Microsoft!
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with some of the features of this keyboard. For one thing, there is no indicators that tell you when the CAPS Lock or Numners Lock are turned on, and that is frustrating. I also found that some of the keys have to struck a few times before the letter types into your document. I have to place the keyboard right in front of the screen or the signal may not connect with the computer. Overall, for the money it isn't a bad buy!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, Awesome Mouse, HORRIBLE glitchiness.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using MS ergonomic keyboards for years and was excited to get this set. I had to return it before the week was out, however, because it would constantly miss keystrokes and the mouse was glitchy. I do have a wireless router close by, but I disabled wireless and it did not solve the problem. The keyboard and mouse were both within 3 feet of the receiver. I replaced this with a wired MS ergonomic keyboard and a Logitech G500 wired mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Russ McMissouri

customer_reviews.title: It worked well but then it stopped working after a ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well but then it stopped working after a while. I feel it should last longer than 1 year. I bought another one after that and the same thing happened again. My conclusion is that they don't hold up well, with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Been using this for years at work and they're great; both the keyboard and mouse are easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for years at work and they're great; both the keyboard and mouse are easy to use, and after daily wear for five years, there's NO visible wear on them and I've only had to replace the batteries once.
customer_reviews.author: C. Watne

customer_reviews.title: I would expect more from Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: I received the Microsoft Natural Ergo desktop 7000 and it was a breeze to set up... The keyboard and mouse synched with in seconds,,,The keyboard felt good to type on and those were the only good things about it... The wirless mouse was all over the place constant freezes.. I then realized the right click key kept sticking and could do nothing except pry it up a bit and then it would stick again.... I returned it for a refund.... I am buring instead the ergo 4000 USB keyboard..... AMAZON rocks with customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Boatright

customer_reviews.title: mouse doesn't work with Microsoft Virtual PC
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard and mouse to replace a corded MS ergonomic keyboard that had a couple of keys fail after over a decade of use. But the mouse - specifically the scroll wheel - is not compatible with Microsoft Virtual PC. In my opinion that is design defect that renders the mouse unusable. I use Virtual PCs all the time especially for web browsing. Right now I am using a virtual PC with my old Logitec mouse to write this review. The keyboard is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Rock Classic

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be...
customer_reviews.text: To bad Microsoft decided to go cheap on this kind of hardware.... This keyboard is not what it used to be. No Caps Lock, Num Lock and Scroll Lock light indicator, just low battery led. Cheap materials and assembly. The mouse is now silver and won't slide as easy as the prior version. No software CD. The wireless is weak. For me, big dissapointment.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C5

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME keyboard/mouse set !!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard/mouse is awesome !!! I was a logitech ergo user before, and was cautious about switching to this one. However, this set exceeded all my expectations. Extremely convenient. Function keys are awesome. Everything where you'd expect it. Good wireless range, long battery life (and i'm using it all day). Soft sensitive mouse. No key delays or even wake up time. One more little thing - if you have S-PVA monitor then letters on the keyboard will almost "glow" in the dark. Much better then even macbook pro lighted keyboard. Can't praise it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Crapyntosh

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard! Mouse sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is very soft and supple. It's not a "loud" keyboard in that even if you slam the keys they make very little noise. The spacebar is kind of stubborn but I presume this is due to me needing to get used to it. The mouse, however, just absolutely SUCKS. The shape is odd the placement of the thumb buttons is pretty uncomfortable. The mousewheel is gummy and rigid - thus you'd better hope you don't use it too often or you'll find yourself with a very muscular wheel finger in a short time. Also, using this on Ubuntu Maverick and ALL the special keys except the zoom keys were instantly recognized and fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: Dieguito

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the Natural keyboard once you get used to it you won't want to go back. But the mouse takes a little longer to get used to. The mouse is also heavy. The problem is with the connectivity, you move the mouse and it jumps to different places instead of smoothly. The same with the keyboard. Letters show up a second or two after you typed them. A minute or two of that can really annoy you. That is why I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: bballer

customer_reviews.title: It's nice.
customer_reviews.text: the mouse is basically awesome.. feels great. a bit too hard to motion around though... slow. The keyboard... meh... still haven't gotten used to its feel and i keep hitting the wrong keys. the wrist rest is nice though. When i first got it it kept not communicating right with my computer... losing connection and not connecting at all sometimes.. but now it seems to be working fine. was really frustrating at first.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Work computer keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this product. The mouse did not work well at all. I had problems from the minute I turned it on. It jumped around on the screen and would not track. Changed batteries- no difference. I ended up using my old mouse instead. The keyboard works fine but the mouse was no good. It may have been just a bad mouse but I probably won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma of twins

customer_reviews.title: Terrible buy the Logitech if you want it to work.
customer_reviews.text: Buy a Logitech wireless wave instead! We went through 3 of these and the same issues came up over and over.... Constantly losses connectivity. They are just really flawed. The market for ergonomic wireless is really thin. Trust me. Buy the Logitech. We've bought 3 since for employees since we figured out these were junk...
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K.

customer_reviews.title: Love it and hate it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard except it makes so much noise when you hit the space bar. Click, Click, Click. I am trying to learn to ignore the clicking. As for the mouse, I love it some days and hate it the next. I really have to think about where my hand and wrist are so I am in alingment with the mouse. Been two months and I am still working on it. In the long run except for the clicking, I think it will be a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: famousjane

customer_reviews.title: Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Just a small note. Nice keybard, everything I wanted, however, for me, I needed to attach the USB transmitter at the end of a USB extention cable and place it behind the monitor. Most of the time, you can connect the transmitter right to the back of your PC. But sometimes, that's just not close enouph for the keyboard to "see" the transmitter and you'll get dropped connections from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Heat

customer_reviews.title: love the keyboard, but incompatible with 32-bit processor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard for my wife; she loves it, but has had to return it for the following reasons: 1. According to Microsoft technical support (2nd Level), this keyboard is incompatible with computers running on a 32-bit processor (it requires 64-bit) - NOTE: the system requirements stated above are incorrect. 2. The wonderful, specially designed ergonomic mouse is ONLY for RIGHT handed people. If you are left handed, you must either adapt to using the right handed mouse, or not use it at all and provide a different mouse. According to Microsoft, they do not make a left handed ergonomic mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: 7000 wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Desktop 7000 that I have used. I like every thing about it, except the reason I replaced the first one and why I did not give it five stars. At times it does not type when I push a key. It got so bad with the first one, I threw it away and bought the second. I like the keyboard well enough that if I have to replace it every couple of years I will do so.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Simoneau

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these keyboards when they first came out and had to be connected to your computer. At the time I was a big "chatter" and over the time I had it, my nails actually cut grooves in some of the letters! My favorite feature is that the keyboard can be positioned to slant down with the front (side closest to you) being higher than the back (side closest to the monitor). Your wrists don't bend at all. I have carpal tunnel so it makes it so much more comfortable. There is definitely a bit of a learning curve getting used to the shape and the way your hands are positioned, but it is SO worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MS Natural Keyboard/Mouse
customer_reviews.text: IF you like this ergonomic style of hand placement on the keyboard, the MS 7000 is a great product. Fits well, good key action, lots of helpful internet buttons (maybe, maybe not, depending on your need for these). The way-out mouse takes some getting used to, but works great once you get the new "side-ways" position down - I found I need more forearm-elbow support than before, but that's ok. My only complaint is that both (of course) require batteries - more of those to recycle.
customer_reviews.author: DC of the North

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is what you have come to expect from Microsoft Hardware - solid and stable. The mouse works well but takes a little getting used to. The feel of the wheel is a bit mushy - no click feedback but no freewheeling option either. However, say what you like, the natural keyboard shape is the only one that really is ergonomically designed to avoid carpal tunnel. I had a wired natural keyboard prior to this and it really worked to eliminate the pain I was having. The only reason I got rid of the old one was so that I could remove the wires.
customer_reviews.author: DMC Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: The Best Keyboard & Mouse I've Used
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse are excellent! The keyboard is ergonomic, thin and very well shaped. The keys have a good feel and the letters/numbers are very visible. The mouse is slightly tilted to the right and has never caused me any pain unlike other mice I have used. (I don't know if there is a left-hand version.) I have two of these units; one at the office and one at home. I would buy this desktop again if I needed a 3rd one.
customer_reviews.author: R. T. Appleby

customer_reviews.title: It's all about reverst tilt!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, it's the only split style keyboard on the market with reverse tilt, which I feel is the position that has the lowest impact on ones wrist. Highly recommend it to anyone worrying about carpel tunnel syndrome. The mouse on the other hand I'd rate 2.5 stars as it's EXTREMELY fragile - I'm now on my 3rd one.
customer_reviews.author: hybrid

customer_reviews.title: I loved this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard. My only complaint is the current price of them. The only reason I was in the market for another one is because I spilled my coffee on it and it is no longer functional. I went to replace it and found that the price of it had skyrocketed. it's a great keyboard, but it's not worth the $300 it's going for on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Natural Ergo Desktop 7000 Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I've just started using the keyboard today. I have used the Natural Keyboards before but this is my first wireless. The keyboard is comfortable as you can expect from the natural tilt of the keyboard and padded wrests. Keys are a bit stiff but it's new, they should smooth out with use. Jury is still out on the wireless part. I've noticed a delay when typing URL addresses today (2 times) -- depressing a key and not registering for a few seconds...not sure if was a wireless COM issue or my system doing something weird.
customer_reviews.author: CowboyAtHeart

customer_reviews.title: Some problems
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the keyboard. It's convenient to use. On another computer I have a Logitech wireless keyboard with just about the same keyboard layout---but the f1, f2, f3, ... keys are to close tto the 1, 2, 3, ... keys on that keyboard, causing me some trouble. With the Microsoft keyboard I don't have such a problem. However, on the negative side this keyboard some times give random sorts of responses. Some times the same key or short sequeence of keys gets transmitted to the computer; some times the key I strike does not get transmitted to the computer. These are infrequent occurances, but occur often enough to be an anoying feature of the Microsoft-7000 keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: DLFried

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed this keyboard for the few weeks I've had it. We have a decent sized monitor and routinely sit 4-6 feet away from the computer and have never noticed a drop in signal. We also use Mac OS Lion and have had no problems running the drivers and achieving full keyboard functionality with the available extra function and media buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Luap1st

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Gift and at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I found this beauty for less than $100 bucks so I was happy especially when I saw the same thing for a little more than $100 dollars in the store. I love that it has all these great features and has the ergonomic design. I also love the fact that it is wireless. So far so good not one complaint about it, so if it keeps up the good work it will remain a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: butterfly p

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: If you like these styles of keyboards you will LOVE this one. I have been using them in one style of another since 1998, this one is the best yet. Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Desktop 7000 Be aware of merchants selling them separate, the Mouse/keyboard you will get is NOT the newer style USB, it is the OLD style RF usb with a BIG hunk'en receiver that chews up desktop space.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible keyboard. The caps lock key randomly turns on and off. Frequently the keyboard will 'pause' typing for about 10 seconds and then catch up suddenly. I tried every fix on the internet. Nothing worked. Don't buy this keyboard, especially since they force you to buy a mouse you don't need so they can jack up the price! Horrible!
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Bumgarner Jr

customer_reviews.title: TOO EXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: What the beck happened to the price, purchased in Feb 2013 and it was $75. It was well worth the money then because it's a great mouse/keyboard combo. Not now, way too pricey!
customer_reviews.author: chopemupgood

customer_reviews.title: Cordless ergonomic keyboard & mouse
customer_reviews.text: The comfortable and relaxed design of this keyboard makes typing easy by keeping the hands and wrists in a natural position. The additional features of the "F" keys are a bonus. The mouse is another issue. It's easily twice the size of the standard mouse. Though its shape and tilt also puts the hand in a natural, relaxed position, its sizes forces the hand to rest on the small lateral carpal bones. The heel of the mouse hand can become irritated after long periods of use. Overall, the keyboard is really nice but the mouse is awkward.
customer_reviews.author: J. Flora

customer_reviews.title: Love both.
customer_reviews.text: Love both......great set and not too expensive. My wrists were hurting with the standard keyboard and mouse at work so I ordered these. The mouse was a little different than my old one and took a bit to get used to, but now I wouldn't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Microsoft Ergonomic Desktop 7000 because I needed a cheap solution for work. I was able to pick up the set fro under $30 shipped, cannot beat the value. The Keyboard and Mouse set is full of great features like customizable favorite's buttons, and one for calculator. The keyboard and mouse are very comfortable to use and it was easy to set up. I am very satisfied with the purchase and would highly recommend this to anyone that can get their hands on it for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Some dude

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for large hands
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the keyboard, and only took off stars for the mouse. Both units require AA batteries, I have yet to replace the keyboard batteries, but have had to replace the mouse batteries regularly. I wish the mouse has a switch so it could be shut off when not in use. Yes, I know I can remove a battery, but that is very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of typing and so this product saves me a lot of wrist problems. However, I believe there is superior ergonomic designs that Microsoft could be moving towards instead of refurbishing 1995 technology with a 2013 copyright date. So A+ for filling helping as much as it does but D- for failing to think outside their own box in two decades.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Swift Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable lag
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Mouse shape is great -Keyboard shape is great Cons: -I've purchased 2 sets of these, and they started working fine, but eventually they started lagging or disconnecting. It became impossible to type because it wouldn't capture my keystrokes. It was a real shame. -Mouse thumb buttons don't seem to be in a good position, so I don't use them -Range isn't very far (it would be useful to use the keyboard from across the room when I want to control videos that I watch from the couch) I'm returning these to Microsoft as defective.
customer_reviews.author: vk3

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard and Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This Wireless Keyboard and Mouse are great. This is my 2nd one to purchase. I wore out my 1st one after several years of use. Actually, it was the rubber pads on the mouse that started to give way. The use of the mouse made the pads to thin and began to separate from the mouse itself. Great product, NO WIRES.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good, not a permanent capital good.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of this keyboard that's been on my desk and lap. Due to too many years punching makiwara and doing manual labor, I need the expanded layout, and since I prefer keyboarding with my feet up, the wireless feature is excellent. These things tend to lose their rubber "bumpers" and eventually develop shorts. So not a permanent acquisition, but still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Suttton

customer_reviews.title: The best affordable ergonomic setup
customer_reviews.text: This is the gold standard of wireless ergonomic keyboard/mouse products. Skip all other mass-market solutions that claim to be "ergonomic." Your real choices are a standard keyboard and mouse, this setup, or a specialty setup that costs well over $1,000. For me, this one is "just right."
customer_reviews.author: strunkl

customer_reviews.title: Connection drops twice daily, but perfect ergonomics.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 2 days and the connection has dropped at least twice each day. It's a bit tricky to reconnect especially when the receiver is in the back of the computer, which is around the other side of the desk. I just connected a usb extention cable and ran it on top of my desk. We'll see if it helps. It will at least make it easier to reset.
customer_reviews.author: Ohioan

customer_reviews.title: ergonomic AND wireless?  So happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard and mouse combo. Love. I'm a huge believer in ergonomic keyboards, even though I know that if you aren't used to them, them seem awkward. (Trust me, you get over it.) But this keyboard is fantastic, and the mouse- while seemed a little strange to begin with- is extremely comfortable. For someone who works on a computer all day, I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shea

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I liked this so much, I got a second one for my other pc. But the mouse, no. its over engineered feels like a 4x4 under your hand, put it in a drawer with the other one. My favorite mouse is the Microsoft ARC Mouse. simple, sensitive and comfortable. Too bad they only make 2 colors now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Snizek

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard does not work!  Sold with expired batteries
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sold me this item, ordered in August and it was shipped with batteries that expired in May. It took me months to figure out why my keyboard was so slow and slow to catch up with my typing. After replacing the batteries the problem still exists. I spend double the amount of time typing. Its a mess! I cannot return now or get a replacement from amazon and I am really annoyed. Do not order! I had one before, the system is great, just dont get it here.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but does not work correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I had to use another wireless mouse almost from the start with this product. The mouse was very jumpy and sporadic in use, so I use my Logitech mouse with it. But, after the first 6 months or so, the keyboard started randomly freezing and not working. Followed Microsoft's web site suggestions, changing usb ports, using on other computers, etc., but that did not help. I love the look and feel of this product, but you may very well find it will give you problems!
customer_reviews.author: PBednar

customer_reviews.title: Initial not-very-smooth keyboard response improves with time
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after many years with the Microsoft Natural Multimedia Keyboard, unfortunately no longer made. The Natural Ergo 7000 doesn't have as smooth keys, but they do get somewhat smoother as they "break in." Bring back the Natural Multimedia Keyboard, Microsoft! [And bring back Win7 while you are at it....]
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money now
customer_reviews.text: I work 2 jobs from home on the computer so my equipment gets a great deal of use. I purchased this set 7/13 for <$85 from Amazon. I have worn the letters off the keyboard and it is starting to stutter and the mouse is getting jerky. I was interested in replacing with the same set. I was appalled to find the keyboard and mouse now selling for $330. It is not worth the money now.
customer_reviews.author: katielu

customer_reviews.title: I really like this upgraded model
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard set is exactly what I was looking for. I really like this upgraded model, compared to my older version. It's sleek, slim and comfortable, I still use the set.
customer_reviews.author: Daymond Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Bought This One for Hubby
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my husband and he likes it a lot. It said that it took some time to get use to the larger (and heavier) mouse, but once he did he like it. The keyboard has programmable keys and if you download the software from Microsoft's site, you will have more options and can do some customization.
customer_reviews.author: Pmyrick

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Desktop Available
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best wireless keyboard/mouse set on the market, not to mention one of the few with full ergonomic layout. I've had a set at work for more than two years. Just bought this second set from Amazon for home. Even if you haven't used an ergonomic keyboard before, do not shy away from them. Within two or three days you won't even notice the new layout, you'll automatically adjust. You will notice how less tired your hands and wrists are; I can type for hours with no noticeable fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: btn2403

customer_reviews.title: The mouse works fine, but the keyboard is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The wireless keyboard is horrible. I have to constantly double checking and correcting, what I'm typing. It drops keys, repeats keys , and I often have to wait for it to respond. I have updated the drivers and replaced the batteries. It's still horrible. Typing this short review was a pain
customer_reviews.author: sand1015

customer_reviews.title: Having some issue with the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on my Windows 7 desktop. The mouse works great, and doesn't strain my wrist too much. The keyboard sometime gives me problem though. It would become unresponsive for a brief moment, and not outputting anything that I typed, or output it a couple seconds later. It can be a little bit frustrating. I suspect it has to do with me placing it close to my monitor, which somehow interferes with the keyboard's wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Li

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is good, for me the ergonomic design allows me to ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is good, for me the ergonomic design allows me to type in full comfort. When i am typing on a regular keyboard my fingers tend to feel as if they are going stiff. The side number pad is an added plus.
customer_reviews.author: IamME

customer_reviews.title: Second choice, better than first.
customer_reviews.text: Of the few ergonomic keyboards available, this is the best choice at a reasonable price. Keytronics was my first choice, very happy with prior units. Their latest "Wave" was very uncomfortable so I returned it and went with choice number 2. The wireless mouse seems huge at first, but is quite comfortable once you use it awhile. One drawback is there is no light or screen indicator for Caps Lock, Num Lock or Scr Lock.)
customer_reviews.author: Tester311

product_meta.title: Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Desktop 7000
product_meta.description:
Style:RetailFROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT NATURAL ERGONOMIC DESKTOP 7000
Advanced ergonomic design ADVANCED ERGONOMICS MEETS ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY
Reduce strain and make time with your computer more enjoyable by using the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Desktop 7000, a combination of the most advanced ergonomic designs for a keyboard and mouse. By resting your arms, wrists, and hands in a more natural position, you reduce pressure on sensitive areas, such as your carpal tunnel, and the potential for injuries resulting from unhealthy posture. In addition, you can take advantage of technology advancements with this keyboard and mouse set and work from up to 30 feet away from your computer with wireless technology. For close-in tasks, use the zoom slider located in the middle of the keyboard to easily zoom in and out by touching your finger on it. Breeze through documents, media files, and webpages easily by using the four-way tilt-scroll wheel on the mouse, aided by the precision and accuracy of industry-leading, high-definition laser technology.


KEY FEATURES
 1. 2.4-GHz Wireless Technology - Enjoy the 2.4-gigahertz (GHz) wireless technology, which delivers a reliable connection with up to a 30-foot range, with virtually no interference.
    
    
 2. Advanced Ergonomic Design - Work in total comfort by using a mouse and keyboard designed to encourage natural wrist and arm alignment.
    
    
 3. Four-Way Scrolling - Scroll four ways for greater efficiency and comfort by using the tilt wheel.
    
    
 4. Magnifier - Point and click to enlarge and edit details by using the magnifier.
    
    
 5. Battery Life Indicator - Avoid getting caught with a dead battery. The battery status indicator glows red when the battery is running low.
    
    


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Device Stage - Quickly and easily access common tasks, including product information, registration, settings, and more for popular devices such as cell phones, cameras, printers, and mouse, keyboard, and webcam products.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Computer/Operating System
   Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP Pro/Pro x64 Edition/Home/Media Center Edition/Tablet PC Edition, Windows 2000 with Service Pack 4 (SP4) or later.
   
 * Hard Drive
   60 MB free (install 100 MB)
 * Other
   USB port
